column4: purpz: I think you need to run "sudo chown -R root:root /usr/share/eggdrop/scripts"
purpz: I think you need to run "sudo chown -R root:root /usr/share/eggdrop/scripts"
purpz: I think you need to run "sudo chown -R root:root /usr/share/eggdrop/scripts"
Ack so sorry.
I didn't realize.
have you tried asking in #eggdrop about your bot issue?
I hadn't...I presumed it was a permissions problem
looks like a permissions problem but i am wondering why those two .tcl files went missing. #eggdrop probably can help explain it
If I can get it back to where that's happening I can ask there...:)
then in that case undoing the chown should get you back to the previous error
undecim I ran 'sudo chown -R root:root eggdrop' from /usr/share and I now getting "./eggdrop: is a directory" when I run './eggdrop;
well you don't want eggdrop owned by root
Nope, i don't...
so change it back to your user
K, so I ran 'sudo chown -R username:username eggdrop'
now ./eggdrop
./eggdrop is a directory
you have run the bot before right? I don't remember the command to start the bot. something -m botname.conf I think
Yes, it was working before I started tinkering with this
it has been so long since I ran eggdrop, I really think you would be better off asking in #eggdrop and hope you get a sympathetic user to help you even though they might say it isn't their problem.
Ok, will shoot over there and see, thanks for your time.
